meanings.definition: Outside the territory or jurisdiction of a particular country
meanings.sent1: The embassy had extraterritorial privileges, allowing it to operate independently from local laws.
meanings.sent2: The company's extraterritorial operations made it difficult for the government to regulate.
meanings.sent3: The extraterritorial ducks decided to hold a quacking contest in international waters.
meanings.sent4: Her extraterritorial mindset soared above the constraints of national boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The extraterritorial concept of diplomatic immunity shielded him from legal repercussions.

meanings.definition: Relating to or existing beyond the boundaries of a specific territory
meanings.sent1: The treaty included extraterritorial provisions to address cross-border disputes.
meanings.sent2: The extraterritorial trade agreements opened up new markets for the country.
meanings.sent3: The extraterritorial cat wandered into the neighboring yard and made friends with the local felines.
meanings.sent4: His extraterritorial perspective allowed him to see global issues from a unique angle.
meanings.sent5: The extraterritorial boundaries of the internet connect people across the world.
